Navigation
Name Rascal/Patterns/Abstract/MultiVariable
Synopsis Multi-variable in abstract pattern.
Syntax Var*
Description A multi-variable is an abbreviation for a variable declaration pattern. It can occur in a list pattern or set pattern and can match zero or more list or set elements.
Examples 
rascal>import IO;
ok
Using lists: 
rascal>if([10, N*, 50] := [10, 20, 30, 40, 50])
>>>>>>>   println("Match succeeds, N == <N>");
Match succeeds, N == [20,30,40]
ok
the above is equivalent with: 
rascal>if([10, list[int] N, 50] := [10, 20, 30, 40, 50])
>>>>>>>   println("Match succeeds, N == <N>");
Match succeeds, N == [20,30,40]
ok
Using sets: 
rascal>if({10, S*, 50} := {50, 40, 30, 30, 10})
>>>>>>>   println("Match succeeds, S == <S>");
Match succeeds, S == {30,40}
ok
the above is equivalent with: 
rascal>if({10, set[int] S, 50} := {50, 40, 30, 30, 10})
>>>>>>>   println("Match succeeds, S == <S>");
Match succeeds, S == {30,40}
ok
